SEARCH

Class Predator

java.lang.Object
Boid
Predator
public class Predator extends Boid
The Predator class represents predator boids in a predator-prey simulation. It inherits basic boid behaviors such as cohesion, separation, and alignment from the Boid class and adds a behavior to chase prey.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Predator

      public Predator(Point2D.Float[] position, Point2D.Float[] velocity, float maxSpeed, float maxForce, float fieldOfView, long step, int diameter, float cohesionCoeff, float alignmentCoeff, float seperationCoeff)
      Constructs a Predator instance with specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      position - Initial positions of the boids.
      velocity - Initial velocities of the boids.
      maxSpeed - Maximum speed of the boids.
      maxForce - Maximum force that can be applied to the boids.
      fieldOfView - Field of view angle for the boids.
      step - Simulation step size.
      diameter - Diameter of each boid for visualization.
      cohesionCoeff - Coefficient for cohesion behavior.
      alignmentCoeff - Coefficient for alignment behavior.
      seperationCoeff - Coefficient for separation behavior.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(Prey preys, int width, int height)
      Updates the state of each predator boid in the simulation by applying the behavior forces, updating the velocity and position, and ensuring the predators chase prey.
      Parameters:
      preys - The instance of the Prey class representing the prey in the simulation.
      width - Width of the simulation area.
      height - Height of the simulation area.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides a string representation of the Boid object. This representation includes details about each predator boid's position and velocity . The string starts with a header "Boid:" Each boid's details are listed in a formatted manner.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Boid
      Returns:
      A string representation of the Boid object.
